page.title: 18VISITING HAMPTON WATERWORKS
page.content: In October 1984 the 4th year of Hampton Junior School visited the waterworks and apart from Nichola's asthma attack everything went smoothly. We saw the filter beds, the chlorination house and the pumping station. We were the first school party to climb to the top of the pumping station which was thoroughly enjoyed as we had an excellent view of Hampton and the river. On the 17th of January 1985 during a cold spell three Victorian watermains burst in Hampton. The nearest one was in Oldfield Road. It flooded the school, the nearby housing estate and turned the railway track at Hampton Station into a river. Many children could not leave their homes that morning to come to school because of the flooding.
